business.headline: Sensex opens 150 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 238.67 points to 85,200.95, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.15 points to 26,193.15 as of 9:22 am.

Reliance Industries denies report on Russian oil deliveries to Jamnagar refineryReliance clarified that its Jamnagar refinery has not received any cargo of Russian oil in the past three weeks. The company also said it is not expecting any deliveries of Russian crude oil in January.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Price band out, does GMP point to 50% listing gains?Bharat Coking Coal IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 1,071.11 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale of 46.57 crore shares, with no fresh issue component.

US plans talks with oil companies on boosting Venezuela output after Maduro ousterThe meetings are crucial to the administration's hopes of getting top US oil companies back into the South American nation after its government, nearly two decades ago, took control of US-led energy operations there.
Sensex closes 322 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 322.39 points to close at 85,439.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 78.25 points to end at 26,250.30.

What worries RBI about India's insurance sector despite its stability?The RBI highlights that the insurance sector is systemically important because of its size, its role as a long-term investor, and its growing links with the wider financial system.

How investors can manage short-term uncertainty with digital gold, ETFs and SGBsFrom an investment perspective, buying physical gold may no longer be the most efficient choice. When purchasing physical gold, investors must pay 3% GST upfront, which immediately impacts returns.

Gold prices rise again as US–Venezuela tensions flare. Buy now or wait?Market participants say the latest geopolitical flare-up has reinforced gold's role as a hedge against uncertainty, at a time when investors are already navigating an uneasy global backdrop.

Mis-selling complaints are rising. Here's what IRDAI's latest report showsData in the IRDAI Annual Report 2024–25 shows that grievances categorised under Unfair Business Practices increased to 26,667 in FY25, up from 23,335 in FY24, a rise of around 14% year-on-year.

US action on Venezuela's oil: Is there an opportunity for India?Indian oil refiners and upstream companies could still find opportunities if Venezuelan crude re-enters global markets and long-pending investments and payments are unlocked.

Cupid share price tumbles nearly 20%. Why is it falling today?Cupid shares have now fallen nearly 30% over the past five trading sessions, wiping out a significant portion of the gains made during a recent sharp rally.

Petrodollar power play: How oil dollars connect to the US attack on VenezuelaWhile Washington has cited narcoterrorism charges and security concerns, questions are being raised over whether Venezuela's vast oil reserves and its efforts to trade oil outside the US dollar system played a role.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks see decline in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 68.48 points to 85,693.53, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.35 points to 26,313.20 as of 9:23 am.

Unhappy with pace of change, Tata Group looks to replace Air India CEO: ReportGroup chairman N Chandrasekaran has spoken with chief executives of at least two large airlines based in the UK and the US.

Venezuela cuts crude output as US oil blockade chokes storageCaracas is in political crisis under an interim government after President Nicolas Maduro and his wife were captured by US forces on Saturday. The OPEC country's oil exports, its main source of revenue, are now at a standstill following a US blockade on tankers under sanctions and the seizure of two oil cargoes last month.

US control of Venezuelan oil could unlock $1 billion in dues for India, lift outputA US-led takeover or restructuring of Venezuela's oil sector could help India recover nearly $1 billion in long-pending dues and revive crude production from fields operated by ONGC Videsh, analysts and industry sources said.

Inside the gig economy: The real cost of your 10-minute deliveriesTen-minute deliveries have become part of everyday life in urban India. What makes that speed possible is rarely part of the conversation. Read on to understand the people, platforms and policies behind it.

Why salaried Indians need a personal finance reset in 2026Rising living costs, changing job patterns and sweeping labour law reforms are urging salaried Indians to rethink how secure their finances really are.

Ban gig work and you don't solve inequality: Eternal CEO Deepinder GoyalEternal founder Deepinder Goyal argued that the gig economy debate is less about wages and more about discomfort with inequality, warning that bans and over-regulation could erase livelihoods instead of fixing systemic gaps.
Sensex closes 573 points higher, Nifty hits fresh high; NTPC up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 573.41 points to close at 85,762.01, while the Nifty50 jumped 182 points to end at 26,328.55​​​​​​​.

entertainment.headline: Riteish Deshmukh opens up on hosting pressures ahead of Bigg Boss Marathi 6 Bigg Boss Marathi Season 6 is set to premiere on January 11, airing on Colors Marathi and streaming on JioHotstar. Riteish Deshmukh returns as host, revealing in a press conference his intention to adopt a calm and observant stance while addressing viewers' and contestants' expectations.

Actor Evangeline Lilly reveals brain damage from head injury, shares health update Evangeline Lilly has disclosed a diagnosis of brain damage following a head injury sustained during a fainting episode at the beach last year. The actor shared updates on her condition and outlook with followers on social media.

The enduring legacy of Ghar Kab Aaoge, Border 2 song that both hurts and heals Nearly three decades after Border, Sandese Aate Hain returns as Ghar Kab Aaoge, reminding us why one of Hindi cinema's most enduring patriotic songs still captures absence, longing, and the silent grief of soldiers and home.

SS Rajamouli's Varanasi teaser creates history with Paris screening at Le Grand Rex The teaser for SS Rajamouli's upcoming film Varanasi was screened at Paris' Le Grand Rex, marking the first time an Indian teaser has been launched at the iconic venue.

Grammy Awards revive album cover category after 50 years to honour visual artists After more than fifty years, the Grammy Awards will once again honour the creative work behind album covers, with a new category that celebrates art directors, designers, and photographers whose visuals shape the musical experience.

The Raja Saab premieres to begin on January 8, tickets priced at Rs 1,000: Report The Raja Saab, starring Prabhas, is set for paid premiere shows on January 8, with multiplex tickets proposed at Rs 1,000 and single screen tickets at Rs 800. The film will release worldwide on January 9.

Jana Nayagan trailer and the Bhagavanth Kesari blueprint that's hard to ignore Jana Nayagan's trailer draws parallels with Bhagavanth Kesari, focusing on women empowerment and political themes. The film doubles as Vijay's political statement ahead of his full-time political debut.

Netflix announces Stranger Things' final season BTS documentary. Watch trailer Netflix unveiled 'One Last Adventure: The Making of Stranger Things Season 5', offering fans an in-depth look at the creation of the acclaimed series' concluding chapter.

They Will Kill You trailer: Zazie Beetz faces satanic cult in this horror-comedy The trailer for director Kirill Sokolov's horror-comedy 'They Will Kill You' is finally out. The Warner Bros film is slated for theatrical release on March 27.

Shefali Shah recalls being bullied, punched and called 'telu' at school Shefali Shah has opened up about facing bullying and appearance-based judgments during her school years. The actor shared personal experiences of being mocked for her looks in a recent interview.

Kiara Advani shares first glimpse of daughter Saraayah: Me and my mini Kiara Advani offered fans a rare look at her daughter Saraayah in a candid Instagram video. The video shows Kiara engaging her daughter in a lighthearted magazine reading session.

Owen Cooper, Timothee Chalamet hold hands, pose for pics at Critics' Choice. Watch A video of Owen Cooper pausing to chat with Timothee Chalamet at the Critics' Choice Awards has gone viral. In the video, the duo can be seen sharing a candid discussion and posing for photographs.

As Yash's birthday nears, fans light up Bangalore with posters. See pics Ahead of his birthday, fans of actor Yash have put up posters across Bangalore to extend their greetings. The teaser for Yash's upcoming film Toxic is also scheduled to release on January 8.

Zarina Wahab says family concept dead in Hindi films, still alive in South cinema Zarina Wahab praised Telugu cinema for making family-oriented films. The actor will next be seen in Prabhas's 'The RajaSaab'.

Krrish 4: Rakesh Roshan debunks rumours of Rajat Bedi playing villain Director Rakesh Roshan clarified that actor Rajat Bedi will not appear as the villain in the upcoming film Krrish 4. He dispelled recent rumours that gained traction online in October 2025.

After Vijay's Jana Nayagan trailer, Balakrishna's Bhagavanth Kesari trends on OTT Balakrishna's 2023 film Bhagavanth Kesari is trending on OTT after the trailer of Jana Nayagan has triggered fresh discussion about the film among fans, who've drawn similarities

Saba Pataudi calls father Mansoor Ali Khan the hero of my universe, shares pics Saba Pataudi paid a heartfelt tribute to her late father Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi on his birth anniversary, calling him "the hero of my universe" and sharing rare photos.

Guillermo del Toro again slams generative AI, calls it prelude to fascism Guillermo del Toro has said that people saying art is not important is "always the prelude to fascism." The 'Frankenstein' director has been known for his criticism of generative AI in the past as well.

Ram Charan hosts Japanese chef Osawa Takamasa for a special biryani feast Japanese biryani chef Osawa Takamasa recently visited actor Ram Charan's residence. He not only prepared biryani for the actor and his family, but also gave a sneak peek into his home.

general news.headline: Drones spotted, gunfire heard near Venezuelan presidential palace in CaracasThe reports came just hours after Vice President Delcy Rodrguez was sworn in on Monday as the country's interim president as deposed leader, Nicolas Maduro appeared in a New York federal court on drug-related charges following the weekend US operation that led to his capture.

Exclusive: How India managed Trump, media, trade talks during Operation SindoorIndia launched Operation Sindoor while engaging the Trump administration in trade and security talks. This dual outreach aimed to manage geopolitical and economic interests amid rising tensions.

92-year-old judge to hear Maduro's case. Why age is just a number for US benchThe lifetime judicial appointments in the US now often span 30 or 40 years. The average age of a federal judge is about 69, according to recent studies, and there is no straightforward mechanism to compel retirement.

Reliance Industries denies report on Russian oil deliveries to Jamnagar refineryReliance clarified that its Jamnagar refinery has not received any cargo of Russian oil in the past three weeks. The company also said it is not expecting any deliveries of Russian crude oil in January.

How US weapons, fidayeen attacks made 2025 deadliest year for PakistanConflict-related deaths in Pakistan surged 74% in 2025 to 3,413, the highest in over a decade. The spike was driven by a surge in fidayeen attacks and the proliferation of US-origin weapons from post-withdrawal Afghanistan, revealed the data from the Pakistan Institute for Conflict and Security Studies (PICSS), an Islamabad-based think tank.

The Raja Saab premieres to begin on January 8, tickets priced at Rs 1,000: ReportThe Raja Saab, starring Prabhas, is set for paid premiere shows on January 8, with multiplex tickets proposed at Rs 1,000 and single screen tickets at Rs 800. The film will release worldwide on January 9.

I have 6, what's stopping you? Owaisi snipes at BJP leader's '4 children' remarkAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi slammed BJP leader Navneet Rana over her suggestion of having four children to maintain demographic balance, saying he has six children, and asked her what was stopping her from having more.

The Prince: Who is Maduro's son with a narco-terror linkAs US authorities put the now deposed President of Venezuela, Nicholas Maduro, before a Manhattan court, attention has turned to the whereabouts of his son, Nicolas Ernesto Maduro Guerra, known as 'The Prince'. Ernesto, who has so far been able to evade US custody, stands accused of the same charges of narco-terrorism that the US has levelled against his father.

The enduring legacy of Ghar Kab Aaoge, Border 2 song that both hurts and healsNearly three decades after Border, Sandese Aate Hain returns as Ghar Kab Aaoge, reminding us why one of Hindi cinema's most enduring patriotic songs still captures absence, longing, and the silent grief of soldiers and home.

Hindu grocery shop owner killed in Bangladesh, 6th in 3 weeksA grocery trader, Mani Chakraborty, was attacked by unidentified assailants while running his shop at the busy market under Palash Upazila. He suffered critical injuries.

Fresh, fit and focused: Can PV Sindhu return to her peak in 2026?At 30, P V Sindhu faces one of the most intriguing challenges of her career: proving that her best days are not in the rear-view mirror. With a series of marquee events lined up in 2026, the two-time Olympic medallist, fresh from an injury layoff, will be hoping for a strong start at this week's Malaysia Open.

Boy, 15, arrested in Punjab for spying for Pak's ISI; more minors under scannerPakistan's intelligence agency ISI is reportedly involving Indian minors in espionage activities, raising serious security concerns in Punjab. Authorities have arrested a 15-year-old boy and are investigating a wider network of minors linked to ISI handlers.

'Roster dating' is not just a trend, it's India's reality todayThe modern dating playbook is as confusing as it gets. The latest addition isn't merely a trend, it's a reality that now has a label. Experts agree there is a modicum of benefit, but warn it can just as easily turn into a slippery slope.

Was captured, I am a decent man: Nicolas Maduro pleads not guilty in US courtPleading innocent in a US court, Maduro told the judge, "I was captured," as he made his first court appearance on drug trafficking charges, adding, "I am a decent man, the president of my country."

Jana Nayagan trailer and the Bhagavanth Kesari blueprint that's hard to ignoreJana Nayagan's trailer draws parallels with Bhagavanth Kesari, focusing on women empowerment and political themes. The film doubles as Vijay's political statement ahead of his full-time political debut.

Cold wave grips Delhi, AQI stays poor, mercury to dip by 3°C across North IndiaDelhi remained under fog and cold wave conditions as air quality stayed 'poor' for the second day, prompting airlines to warn of possible delays. The weather body has forecast a 2–3°C drop in minimum temperatures across northwest India over the next four days.

Mahindra XUV 7XO launched in India, price starts at Rs 13.66 lakhMahindra has unveiled the XUV 7XO in India as the successor to the XUV700, introducing updated styling, enhanced cabin technology and advanced safety features, with prices starting at Rs 13.66 lakh.

Indian man who killed ex-lover in US looted lakhs before fleeing, says her sisterIn her complaint to the Indian Embassy in the US, the victim's sister, Saraswati, detailed the amount of money which was taken by Arjun in the days leading to Nikitha's murder. According to the sister's complaint, the total amount Arjun thus owed to Nikitha's family was USD 4,500 (Rs 4.05 lakh).

Bus ride from London to Calcutta for £145: The 110-day route that once existedLondon to Calcutta, or vice versa, the bus service that operated in the 1960s and 70s offered passengers an unforgettable journey across multiple countries and continents. The 110-day route eventually came to an end due to growing instability in the Middle East.

Trump rules out Venezuela elections in next 30 days, says country must be fixedThe US President said Washington is exploring ways to rebuild Venezuela's economy, including subsidising oil companies to restore the country's energy infrastructure. He said such a project could take less than 18 months.

This Dutch hockey star aims to win Olympic gold, and send it to spaceA solid defender on the field and an engineer off it, Bram van Battum tells India Today how he is able to juggle both his passion for hockey and his dream to become an aerospace engineer. Van Battum will make his Hockey India League bow with SG Pipers.

Meet the lawyer defending Maduro, who also secured Julian Assange's releaseOver a career spanning more than three decades, Barry Pollack has defended corporate executives, political figures and defendants in high-profile federal trials. He is also among the few lawyers to have secured a full acquittal for a former Enron executive after the company's collapse.

Canada's work permit changes to put over a million Indian immigrants at riskCanada could see a surge in undocumented residents by mid-2026 as more than two million work permits would expire this year, with Indians expected to account for nearly half of those at risk. The development comes amid tighter immigration caps under the Mark Carney administration that have narrowed pathways for temporary workers and students.

Kaundinya nears half of journey to Oman, thepla breakfast powers Day 8About a week into its maiden voyage from Porbandar to Muscat, the Indian Navy's stitched sailing vessel INSV Kaundinya is nearing the halfway mark. Early weather conditions slowed progress, but the ship is now back on course. Fresh rations have run out, and the crew has now switched to dry rations. They had thepla and pickle for breakfast on Day 8.

sports.headline: Only had 3-6 months to live: Yuvraj recalls beating death during cancer treatment Yuvraj Singh opened up about his life-threatening cancer diagnosis soon after India's 2011 World Cup win. His successful chemotherapy and strong will led to an inspiring return to international cricket in 2012.

Head enters record books, hits joint-most 100s by an opener in an Ashes series Travis Head scored a commanding 163 runs on Day 3 of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney. His innings equalled the record for most centuries by an opener in a single Ashes series, joining an elite list of 11 other players.

This Dutch hockey star aims to win Olympic gold, and send it to space A solid defender on the field and an engineer off it, Bram van Battum tells India Today how he is able to juggle both his passion for hockey and his dream to become an aerospace engineer. Van Battum will make his Hockey India League bow with SG Pipers.

SA20: Jonny Bairstow slams Keshav Maharaj for record 34 runs in single over Jonny Bairstow smashed 34 runs off Keshav Maharaj in a single over during SA20 2025-26. He whacked the left-arm spinner for five sixes and a boundary.

Ponting's advice for Suryakumar amid poor form: Stop worrying about getting out Former Australia cricketer Ricky Ponting has a piece of advice for struggling India captain Suryakumar Yadav. The T20I skipper has been struggling for form since November 2024.

Fresh, fit and focused: Can PV Sindhu return to her peak in 2026? At 30, P V Sindhu faces one of the most intriguing challenges of her career: proving that her best days are not in the rear-view mirror. With a series of marquee events lined up in 2026, the two-time Olympic medallist, fresh from an injury layoff, will be hoping for a strong start at this week's Malaysia Open.

Captain Suryavanshi's 24-ball 68 seals YODI series win for India vs South Africa Vaibhav Suryavanshi's rapid 68 off 24 balls helped India seal an eight-wicket win against South Africa in the second youth ODI, via DLS method. Suryavanshi narrowly missed out on Rishabh Pant's record for the fastest fifty by an Indian in Youth ODIs during his whirlwind knock.

Bangladesh await ICC reply for next step after T20 World Cup venue change reply After requesting a venue change, Bangladesh Cricket Board president Aminul Islam says that they're waiting for a response from the ICC before taking the next step. Bangladesh cricket sent a letter to the sport's international governing body on Sunday, January 4.

Indian cricketer tests positive for doping An Indian cricketer from Uttarakhand has failed the dope test, PTI reported on Monday, January 5. Rajan Kumar, who bowls left arm pace, has tested positive for three different substances.

Indian badminton looks for a reset as Lakshya, Sat-Chi begin season in 2026 Malaysia Open: Indian badminton endured a difficult season in 2025. As the 2026 season begins, Lakshya Sen, PV Sindhu and Satwik-Chirag will hope to raise their levels once again.

Watch: After Manchester United sack, Ruben Amorim seen smiling in viral videoManchester United has dismissed head coach Ruben Amorim after just 14 months in charge, following the club's draw against Leeds. The decision comes as United sit sixth in the Premier League, with Darren Fletcher set to lead the team against Burnley.

No Virat Kohli in Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy match against RailwaysVijay Hazare Trophy: Senior batter Virat Kohli will not make his return to the Vijay Hazare Trophy in Delhi's next outing against Railways. DDCA president Rohan Jaitley had earlier showed confidence that Kohli would return to the VHT after his mini-break.

Ruben Amorim wasn't a yes man and that's why Manchester United sacked himManchester United have sacked Ruben Amorim after 14 months in charge. However, what finally brought his time at Old Trafford to an end was not merely the club's position in the league table, but his willingness to challenge the authority of those above him, namely Omar Berrada, Jason Wilcox and others within the hierarchy.

Ashes: Ben Stokes unlikely to face sanction over heated exchange with LabuschagneEngland captain Ben Stokes was involved in a brief verbal exchange with Marnus Labuschagne on Day 2 of the Sydney Test, but the incident is viewed as trivial and is unlikely to attract any disciplinary action.

Kohli, I am trying to film with you: MrBeast sends another invite to India starWorld-renowned YouTuber MrBeast, aka James Stephen Donaldson, has sent another invite to India star Virat Kohli to collaborate for a new video for his channel. Kohli is set to represent India in the series against New Zealand.

UP Warriorz await BCCI nod on Pratika Rawal for WPL seasonUP Warriorz head coach Abhishek Nayar said on Monday that the franchise is awaiting a final decision from the BCCI's Centre of Excellence on the availability of India opener Pratika Rawal for the upcoming Women's Premier League season.

Win Asian Games hockey gold, secure LA Olympics qualification and maybe retire: SavitaIndia's veteran goalkeeper Savita Punia has hinted that she may retire from the sport after winning the Asian Games gold this year and securing automatic qualification for the LA Olympics 2028.

Maybe Ruturaj Gaikwad should say I can keep wickets to get India selection: SrikkanthKris Srikkanth has joked that maybe Ruturaj Gaikwad will need to convince the Indian selectors that he can keep wickets to get his spot back in the side. Ruturaj was a surprise omission from the squad for the New Zealand series.

Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah added to national anti-doping agency's testing poolSmriti Mandhana and Jemimah Rodrigues have been added to the National Anti-Doping Agency's Registered Testing Pool for 2026. The expanded list highlights India's focus on aggressive testing ahead of the Commonwealth and Asian Games.

Manchester United reluctantly sack Ruben Amorim, offer bizarre explanationManchester United have reportedly sacked Ruben Amorim following the fallout with the club's board in recent days. Amorim's last game in charge came against Leeds United on Sunday, January 4.

On the chopping block: The brewing power struggle over Manpreet Singh's futureA power struggle within Hockey India threatens Manpreet Singh's future, with selectors and coaches at odds as his 411-cap tally nears governing body president Dilip Tirkey's record. Will the 33-year-old remain part of the plans in a busy year that includes the World Cup in August?

Jemimah Rodrigues should be India's next captain: Marizanne Kapp backs DC skipperMarizanne Kapp believes Jemimah Rodrigues has the leadership qualities to succeed Harmanpreet Kaur as India's next captain after being named Delhi Capitals' skipper for Women's Premier League 2026.

Fit-again Shreyas Iyer to captain Mumbai before New Zealand ODI seriesShreyas Iyer will captain Mumbai in their Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Himachal Pradesh in Jaipur on Tuesday. The fixture marks the Punjab Kings captain's return to competitive cricket following his recovery from a spleen injury.

Sumit Nagal begins 2026 with new tennis academy in ChandigarhSumit Nagal opens his 2026 season with a fresh off-court reset by joining Roundglass Sports. As results fluctuate, the partnership signals renewed focus on structure, stability and a strong return to form.

Root defends England teammate's abysmal dismissal: Can't win games by survivingAshes: England batter Joe Root has defended teammate Jamie Smith after the wicketkeeper was criticised for his dismissal during the New Year's Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

Kapil Dev on Bangladesh players' participation in Golf Tour: No decision yetPGTI President Kapil Dev said no decision has yet been made on allowing Bangladeshi golfers to compete amid recent India-Bangladesh cricket tensions following Mustafizur Rahman's Indian Premier League 2026 snub.

Bangladesh Govt Under 'Tremendous Pressure' After KKR Drops MustafizurFollowing the Bangladesh government's decision to ban the Indian Premier League (IPL) telecast indefinitely, sports analyst Nikhil Naz provides an in-depth analysis.

Pratika Rawal strongly reacts after her edited photos go viral on social mediaAn account claiming to belong to Indian women's cricketer Pratika Rawal spoke out against unauthorised AI-edited photos circulating on social media platforms. Last year, Pratika was one of India's standout performers at the Women's World Cup held on home soil.

How India's one-eyed Tiger overcame career-ending injury to score 2793 Test runsA serious eye injury threatened to end Mansur Ali Khan Pataudi's career before it began. Instead, he rebuilt his game, overcame profound limitations and went on to become one of Indian cricket's most influential captains.

Shubman Gill comes up with idea to help arrest India's Test cricket slide: ReportIndia's new Test captain Shubman Gill has reportedly proposed dedicated 15-day red-ball camps ahead of every Test series, as the team looks to arrest its slide following back-to-back home series defeats and revive its campaign in the World Test Championship.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
